# portkey_mcp_integration (Resource)

Manages a Portkey MCP integration. MCP integrations define an MCP server in the organization's registry, specifying the URL, authentication type, and transport protocol.

## Example Usage

### Basic Usage (SSE transport, no auth)

```terraform
resource "portkey_mcp_integration" "example" {
  name        = "Example MCP Server"
  description = "An example MCP server integration"
  url         = "https://mcp.example.com/sse"
  auth_type   = "none"
  transport   = "sse"
}
```

### With Header Authentication

```terraform
resource "portkey_mcp_integration" "github" {
  name        = "GitHub MCP Server"
  description = "GitHub tools via MCP"
  url         = "https://mcp.github.com/sse"
  auth_type   = "headers"
  transport   = "sse"

  configurations = jsonencode({
    token = var.github_token
  })
}
```

### Streamable HTTP Transport

```terraform
resource "portkey_mcp_integration" "internal" {
  name      = "Internal MCP Server"
  url       = "https://internal-mcp.example.com/mcp"
  auth_type = "oauth_auto"
  transport = "http"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `auth_type` (String) Authentication type for the MCP server. Valid values: `none`, `headers`, `oauth_auto`.
- `name` (String) Name of the MCP integration.
- `transport` (String) Transport protocol for the MCP server. Valid values: `http` (Streamable HTTP), `sse` (Server-Sent Events).
- `url` (String) URL of the MCP server.

### Optional

- `configurations` (String, Sensitive) JSON string of additional configurations (e.g., auth credentials). This is write-only and will not be returned by the API.
- `description` (String) Description of the MCP integration.
- `slug` (String) URL-friendly identifier. Auto-generated from name if not provided.
- `workspace_id` (String) Workspace ID to scope this integration to. Leave empty for org-level.

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the integration was created.
- `id` (String) MCP integration identifier (UUID).
- `last_updated_at` (String) Timestamp when the integration was last updated.
- `owner_id` (String) Owner user ID.
- `status` (String) Integration status.
- `type` (String) Integration type.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using the MCP integration UUID
terraform import portkey_mcp_integration.example <integration-id>
```
